design_overview.design_scope: Design of a single-agent system for PubMed Central literature retrieval, filtering, and summarization with AWS S3 integration
design_goals: Create a specialized agent for academic literature retrieval and analysis from PMC
Implement efficient AWS S3 integration for accessing PMC open data
Develop intelligent filtering and relevance ranking algorithms
Support multiple citation formats and report structures

key_design_decisions.decision: Single-agent architecture based on deep_research_agent template
key_design_decisions.rationale: The functionality follows a cohesive, linear workflow from data retrieval to report generation, making a single-agent approach more efficient than multi-agent coordination
alternatives: Multi-agent system with specialized agents for retrieval, analysis, and reporting

key_design_decisions.decision: AWS S3 no-sign-request integration for PMC data access
key_design_decisions.rationale: Provides secure, efficient access to PMC open data without requiring AWS credentials
consequences: Direct access to raw PMC data

key_design_decisions.rationale: Enables more accurate ranking of literature based on multiple factors beyond simple keyword matching
Reduces repeated S3 access for frequently used metadata, improving performance

agents.name: pubmed_literature_agent
agents.purpose: Retrieve, filter, analyze, and summarize academic literature from PubMed Central based on user queries

personality.communication_style: Professional and academic with clear explanations of research methodologies
personality.tone: Formal and scholarly with appropriate scientific terminology

core_functions: AWS S3 PMC data integration and retrieval
Key information extraction from academic articles
Citation formatting in multiple academic styles
limitations: Limited to PubMed Central open access articles
No full-text analysis beyond metadata and abstracts
No integration with reference management software
No real-time journal impact factor updates
tools_required: http_request (API calls and web data retrieval)

knowledge_domain.expertise_level: Expert in PubMed Central structure and academic literature analysis
knowledge_domain.update_frequency: Monthly for impact factor data, real-time for PMC content access

interaction_patterns.conversation_flow: Initial query → clarification if needed → processing status updates → structured results
error_responses: Clear error identification with specific error codes
Suggestions for query refinement when results are insufficient
Graceful degradation when AWS S3 access fails
Transparency about data limitations and gaps

constraints: Must access PMC data exclusively through the provided AWS S3 bucket
Must operate within the limitations of the no-sign-request access method
Must respect PMC data usage policies and copyright restrictions
Must handle processing failures gracefully during batch operations
evaluation_criteria: Search result relevance compared to user query

model_requirements.rationale: Claude 3 Sonnet provides excellent text comprehension and structured data parsing capabilities needed for academic literature analysis while balancing performance and cost

memory_configuration.retention_policy: Retain search queries and results for current session, cache metadata for frequent articles
memory_configuration.retrieval_strategy: Direct lookup for cached items, S3 retrieval with pagination for new searches

system_integration.entry_point: User query for literature search with optional parameters
